title: Job 13:1
text: LO, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

title: Job 13:2
text: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

title: Job 13:3
text: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

title: Job 13:4
text: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.

title: Job 13:5
text: O that ye would altogether hold your peace!  and it should be your wisdom.

title: Job 13:6
text: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

title: Job 13:7
text: Will ye speak wickedly for God?  and talk deceitfully for him?

title: Job 13:8
text: Will ye accept his person?  will ye contend for God?

title: Job 13:9
text: Is it good that he should search you out?  or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?

title: Job 13:10
text: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

title: Job 13:11
text: Shall not his excellency make you afraid?  and his dread fall upon you?

title: Job 13:12
text: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.

title: Job 13:13
text: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.

title: Job 13:14
text: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

title: Job 13:15
text: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

title: Job 13:16
text: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

title: Job 13:17
text: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

title: Job 13:18
text: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.

title: Job 13:19
text: Who is he that will plead with me?  for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.

title: Job 13:20
text: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

title: Job 13:21
text: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

title: Job 13:22
text: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

title: Job 13:23
text: How many are mine iniquities and sins?  make me to know my transgression and my sin.

title: Job 13:24
text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

title: Job 13:25
text: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro?  and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?

title: Job 13:26
text: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

title: Job 13:27
text: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.

title: Job 13:28
text: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
